entities.name: snape
entities.description: Snape is introduced as the one who opens a door and looks at Harry and Ron. The text describes him as 'coldly' and 'softly', indicating his personality.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is mentioned as 'the famous Harry Potter' by Snape, indicating that he is a well-known person in the wizarding world.

entities.name: weasley
entities.description: Weasley is referred to as Harry's 'faithful sidekick', indicating that he is associated with Harry.

entities.name: king’s cross
entities.description: King’s Cross is mentioned as the location of a barrier that caused problems for Harry and Ron.

relationships.description: Snape scolds Harry for arriving at King’s Cross in a way that caused attention.
Snape also scolds Weasley, indicating that he is not just targeting Harry.
